pkgmetadata.longdescription:
Horcrux is a Proxmox VE alternative built natively for Gentoo Linux.
It provides enterprise-grade virtualization management with support for QEMU/KVM, LXC containers, Docker, and Podman. Horcrux embraces the Gentoo philosophy of choice by offering extensive USE flags for customization.
Features: - Multi-hypervisor support (QEMU/KVM, LXD, Incus) - Container runtimes (LXC, Docker, Podman) - Multiple storage backends (ZFS, Ceph, LVM, NFS, CIFS, iSCSI) - Software-defined networking with VXLAN and VLANs - High availability clustering with Corosync/Pacemaker - Automated backups with retention policies - Role-based access control (RBAC) - OpenID Connect (OIDC) authentication - Web-based management interface (Yew/WebAssembly) - RESTful API for automation - Cloud-init integration - VM templates and cloning - Live VM migration - Advanced monitoring with OpenTelemetry - Alert system with multiple notification channels

use.flag: Enable QEMU/KVM hypervisor support for hardware virtualization
Enable LXD support for system containers and VMs
Enable Incus support (LXD fork) for containers and VMs
Enable ZFS storage backend with native snapshot support
Enable Ceph RBD distributed storage backend
Enable LVM storage backend with snapshot support
Enable automated backup and restore functionality
Enable high availability clustering with Corosync
Enable TLS/SSL support for encrypted connections
Build and install WebAssembly-based web management interface
Install systemd service unit (default: OpenRC init script)
